snippet: The growing importance of international air traffic is redrawing route maps, even to cities away from the coastal United States.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column; growing importance of international air traffic is redrawing route maps, even to cities away from the coastal United States; it accounts for over 25 percent of passengers on American, Delta and United.
lead_paragraph: The growing importance of international air traffic is redrawing route maps, even to cities away from the coastal United States.

headline.print_headline: Airlines Head Abroad, and Also Inland
headline.main: Airlines Head Abroad, and Also Inland
